Ahri main here.
https://i.imgur.com/qWY9Boe.png
TF has a much higher pick rate, and less than 1% difference in win rate. Why are we complaining about Ahri?
Not flaming, just genuinely curious why TF can go under the radar for patches upon patches but every single time Ahri gets in the spotlight, it's like she's the most overbearing champion the game has ever seen. Her charm buff didn't fix any of her weaknesses that hold her back from being a top tier pick, and people just don't seem to be able to know what a sidestep is.

Ahri isn't as intuitive to play against as TF during laning phase for many.

Her Q is too fast for most laners to sidestep early on. Her W doesn't have any real way to play against it when she activates it. Her E is an abrupt CC that jerks your control away and even moves your character toward Ahri. Naturally it makes you a little more irritated than TF's gold card.

TF's laning phase, meanwhile, is a bit more readable. His Q is about weaving between two cards. His W is easy to read unless it is snap casted, and you can walk out of the danger zone if you're casually last hitting creeps. TF's ult also announces itself, so you can prepare for his TP.

It's less about who's strong and more about who feels better to play against.

I mean playing against Twisted Fate isn't that fun either. I've been seeing a few grasp tf's in diamond lately, and it's really frustrating to play against. He's too tanky to kill, he has a point and click stun, he does a surprising amount of damage even if he only has catalyst, and you can't outroam him because he gets free roams with his ulti.

Maybe .4 seconds was a bit much. Maybe lvl 1 E should start at 1.25 seconds. 

But either way, I don't understand exactly why this small buff was enough to swing her winrate by 3%. There are many buffs each patch that are stronger and more drastic than this ahri buff is, but they never see a winrate swing this big. 

I know that a .4 second buff is really high but I really just don't see how it can take her from lower half of the pack to 2nd best mid in the game (according to champion.gg) I mean when Power of Evil picked her in the LCS recently he literally was just a charm bot for the entire game. The only thing he did was charm aatrox while he was in his ult to keep him from running too far before the ult wore off.

This always happens when Ahri gets utility.  It doesn't make sense, but it never fails.  As much as people complain if her damage ever goes up, any time she gets a utility buff, her winrate jumps disproportionately.  It's the same as 5.2: she was mediocre before it, then when they removed DFG, they compensated by removing her Charm amp too, and adding Q's homeguard effect.  Winrate should have gone down, instead we get 57%, at the time the tenth highest in League history, including Beta, from that one effect.  Then came the Gangplank and Fiora reworks, and the advent of Class Updates, and 57% stopped being impressive.

Now it's the same deal: she was underpowered after they removed the speed and added Charm amp back, so they made a couple minor Quality of Life changes to Charm; the increased duration was meant solely to help land Q's return, since players would rather put points into E to help Q than level her underpowered W.  Suddenly she's in the upper tiers of Midlane.  Could be the nerfs to bruisers, her most hated class, amplifying the issue, but since she actually appeared in pro play for once, expect nerfs to everything except Charm once Rito has a spare team.

I agree with you. Ahri's level of safety is just stupidly high. Everytime Ahri hits 6, this is what happens:

>  > Le me wanting to go in
>  > Ahri drops to 50% HP
> > "Hurr durr, let me dash 3 times back into tower range"
> > Boom, I just wasted cooldowns and even my ignite for that

And if I get too low from engaging her, she'll just waste another dash and unload her kit and then dash back to safety.

The worst part is that her R has almost 100% uptime during the laning phase. The only realistic way you can catch off Ahri is by running Frozen Mallet on someone like Yi, or blowing her up the second she uses her dash (which is pretty impossible, considering that once she uses up her 1st dash, expect the next 2 dashes to be used to get away or juke abilities really fast.)

What I'm trying to emphasize here is that Ahri has too much safety and doesn't even sacrifice an inch of damage for it. Some of that safety has to go if people want to actually play against her and not just rely on letting her pop her 3 dashes that decides on who lives and who dies.
